page.title: 06RECREATION-COUNTY CRICKET
page.content: County cricket is an important part of Somerset life particularly in Taunton. The largest crowd at the County Ground is about 11,000 and the club has about 6,000 members, but this has decreased slightly over the last year. There are 115 full time employees,22 of them players. The manager ,Mr.Tony Brown,said that the average earnings of players for six months was Â£7,500 plus any money for endorsing sports goods.The club itself relied heavily on sponsors to keep it running. Because of the Bradford disaster the old pavilion has been closed and will be replaced when money is available together with more permanent seating. In 1985 our most famous players are Ian Botham,Viv Richards and Joel Garner.
